system for on-line information development 联机信息开发系统

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都可表示"坚定的，结实的"之意。
means: firm ： 侧重指质地坚硬、不易切割或有弹性，一旦变形会很快恢复原形。
hard ： 侧重有抗拒压力或拉力的性质，但不一定有弹性。
solid ： 着重质地紧密、坚实和无间隙，含有在外部压力下仍可保持原有形状的意味。

word_mean: 固体的：非液体或气体的，非中空的
固体：一种非液体或气体的物质或组织
固体电解质气体传感器
solid-state electrolyte gas transducer 利用固体电解质气敏元件作为敏感元件的气体传感器。
solid-stem liquid-in-glass thermometer 具有厚壁毛细管，其温度值直接刻在毛细管上的玻璃温度计。
固体电解质湿度传感器
solid-state electrolyte humidity transducer 利用固体电解质湿敏元件作为敏感元件的传感器。

sentence.Network_en: Solid low-level waste will be disposed of deep underground.
sentence.Network_cn: 放射性水平低的固体废料将做地下深埋处理。

sentence.Network_en: The car park was absolutely packed solid with people.
sentence.Network_cn: 停车场被人挤得水泄不通。

sentence.Network_en: Banks are built to look solid to reassure their customers.
sentence.Network_cn: 银行往往建得看上去很坚固，好让顾客放心。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin solidus; related to salvus 'safe' and sollus 'entire'

entry.def: A solid substance or object stays the same shape whether it is in a container or not.

example.ex: ...the potential of greatly reducing our solid waste problem...
example.tran: 大幅减少我们固体废料问题的可能性

example.ex: He did not eat solid food for several weeks.
example.tran: 他数周以来都没有食用固体食物。

entry.def: A solid is a substance that stays the same shape whether it is in a container or not.

example.ex: Solids turn to liquids at certain temperatures.
example.tran: 固体在一定的温度下会变为液体。

example.ex: ...the decomposition of solids.
example.tran: 固体的分解

entry.def: A substance that is solid is very hard or firm.

example.ex: The snow had melted, but the lake was still frozen solid...
example.tran: 雪已经融化了，湖面却依然冻得硬邦邦的。

example.ex: The concrete will stay as solid as a rock.
example.tran: 混凝土会像岩石一样坚固。

entry.tran: 无空隙的;实心的;非中空的
entry.def: A solid object or mass does not have a space inside it, or holes or gaps in it.

example.ex: ...a tunnel carved through 50ft of solid rock.
example.tran: 打通了 50 英尺厚的实心岩石修建而成的隧道

example.ex: ...a solid wall of multicoloured trees.
example.tran: 五彩缤纷、密密实实的林带

entry.def: If an object is made of solid gold or solid wood, for example, it is made of gold or wood all the way through, rather than just on the outside.

example.ex: The taps appeared to be made of solid gold.
example.tran: 水龙头似乎是用纯金制成的。

example.ex: ...solid wood doors.
example.tran: 实木门

entry.def: A structure that is solid is strong and is not likely to collapse or fall over.

example.ex: Banks are built to look solid to reassure their customers...
example.tran: 银行往往建得看上去很坚固，好让顾客放心。

example.ex: The car feels very solid.
example.tran: 这部车子令人感觉十分皮实。

entry.def: If you describe someone as solid, you mean that they are very reliable and respectable.

example.ex: You want a husband who is solid and stable, someone who will devote himself to you...
example.tran: 你要的是一个可靠而稳重的丈夫——一个全心全意对你的人。

example.ex: All the band come from good, solid, working-class backgrounds...
example.tran: 所有的乐手都来自值得我们尊敬的工人阶级。

entry.tran: (证据、消息等)可靠的，确凿的，有根有据的
entry.def: Solid evidence or information is reliable because it is based on facts.

example.ex: We don't have good solid information on where the people are...
example.tran: 我们还没有得到关于大家现在所处位置的确切消息。

example.ex: Some solid evidence was what was required...
example.tran: 需要的是一些确凿的证据。

entry.tran: (工作、意见等)切实有用的，充实的，实实在在的
entry.def: You use solid to describe something such as advice or a piece of work which is useful and reliable.

example.ex: The CIU provides churches with solid advice on a wide range of subjects...
example.tran: 哥伦比亚国际大学为教堂在许多问题上提供了切实有用的建议。

example.ex: All I am looking for is a good solid performance...
example.tran: 我就希望能有一个上佳的表现。

entry.tran: (政策的依据、对组织的支持)牢固的，坚实的，充分的
entry.def: You use solid to describe something such as the basis for a policy or support for an organization when it is strong, because it has been developed carefully and slowly.

example.ex: I am determined to build on this solid foundation.
example.tran: 我决定在这个坚实的基础之上继续努力。

example.ex: ...a Democratic nominee with solid support within the party and broad appeal beyond.
example.tran: 拥有党内成员的强力支持、受到党外民众广泛欢迎的民主党提名人

entry.def: If you do something for a solid period of time, you do it without any pause or interruption throughout that time.

example.ex: We had worked together for two solid years.
example.tran: 我们一起共事了整整两年时间。

means.word_mean: 1. a substance that is solid at room temperature and pressure
2. the state in which a substance has no tendency to flow under moderate stress; resists forces (such as compression) that tend to deform it; and retains a definite size and shape
1. of definite shape and volume; firm; neither liquid nor gaseous;

sentences.sentence: "ice is water in the solid state"

means.word_mean: 3. entirely of one substance with no holes inside;
4. of one substance or character throughout;
5. uninterrupted in space; having no gaps or breaks;
7. of good quality and condition; solidly built;
9. not soft or yielding to pressure;
12. entirely of a single color throughout;
13. acting together as a single undiversified whole;

auth_sentence.content: They've been very solid, certainly in defence.
auth_sentence.res_content: They've been very solid, certainly in defence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They've been very solid, certainly in defence.

auth_sentence.content: Thankfully I managed to put down a solid run.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thankfully I managed to put down a solid run.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thankfully I managed to put down a solid run.

auth_sentence.content: This is a solid album worthy of respec'.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is a solid album worthy of respec'.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is a solid album worthy of respec'.

stems_affixes.word_buile: solid巩固,团结→n.固体, 立体 adj.固体的, 实心的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 团结一致的,休戚相关的
stems_affixes.word_buile: solid巩固,团结+ary表形容词→adj.团结一致的,休戚相关的
solid巩固,团结→n.固体, 立体 adj.固体的, 实心的
solidary[adj.团结一致的,休戚相关的]+ity表名词→solidarity团结
solid巩固,团结+ify表动词→v.[使]凝固,[使]团结, 巩固

Sentence.sentence: Learning to express ideas well in both writing and speech, knowing how to find information, and knowing how to do research are all solid background skills for a wide variety of roles, and such training is more important than any particular major in a liberal arts college.
Solid background knowledge in a particular field
Yes, yes, he had on a dark sweater, a solid color.
They form a solid basis for policy making.
Its conclusion is not based on solid scientific evidence.
What he tried to do was to teach a male dolphin called Bass and a female called Doris to communicate with each other across a solid barrier.

sentences.en: Ice is water in a solid state.
A bar of iron is solid; a pipe is hollow.
sentences.cn: 铁棍是实心的, 而管子是空心的。

sentences.en: This old house has a very solid foundation.
sentences.cn: 这所旧房子有非常结实的地基。

sentences.en: I know that James is a solid type of person.
sentences.cn: 我知道詹姆斯是个可信赖的人。

means.word_mean: 纯粹的; 纯质的; 纯色的

sentences.en: Iron, wood and ice are solids.

jushi.english: He had a solid excuse for being absent.
She put in a solid week on an editorial.
jushi.chinese: 她花了整整一星期写一篇社论。

jushi.english: Water in a solid state is ice.
